title: Ticket #1476: DAGMan leaves node jobs running when held/dag file removed/released
description:
Steps to Reproduce:
  ===================
  * Submit a dagman job, wait for it to queue up and start to run.
  * Suspend the dagman parent process (condor_hold)
  * Delete the submission.dag file
  * Resume the dagman parent process (condor_release)

At this point, the actual DAGMan job is gone from the queue, but any node jobs submitted before the hold are still running...

We should remove all of the node jobs in this case (at least by default -- maybe have a config knob for whether to remove them?).
remarks:
I tested the fix for #1490 in this case, and it doesn't fix this problem (see also ticket #1910).

2011-May-26 13:07:13 by wenger:
I finally got a chance to look at this. I don't see any real problems. The only thing I'd change is to make a small method in the Dag class (like Dag::RemoveAllCondorJobs() or something) to avoid having duplicate code in Dag::RemoveRunningJobs() and main_init(). Oh, yeah -- it would be great to make a test for this...

2011-May-26 13:08:33 by wenger:
Also, I don't see any need for a knob to allow the user to control this behavior -- when DAGMan is removed, all of its jobs should be removed.

2011-May-31 14:56:29 by tstclair:
Why wouldn't you just call RemoveRunningJobs()? Am I missing something?

2011-May-31 15:52:34 by wenger:
If you just call RemoveRunningJobs(), it won't remove any jobs in this case, because if the DAG file is gone, DAGMan won't think there are any Condor jobs in the DAG. So we need a subset of RemoveRunningJobs() that doesn't have the logic that decides whether there are any Condor jobs in the DAG.

2011-Jun-08 13:40:11 by wenger:
I took at look at this just after Tim C committed it -- looks okay...
attachments:
• dagparse.patch 1265 bytes added by jrt on 2011-Apr-18 21:55:06 UTC.
    Condor_dagman bails because it can't find the dag file. Without the dag file, it can't perform a recovery which is how a release is handled. Here's a patch that checks for a lock file when the dag file is not found. If there is a lock file, a condor_rm is done on the DAGManJobId._cluster followed by a cleanup and exit.

    I didn't put in a knob to toggle behavior, but that could be added. I'm not sure letting the jobs complete has benefits or is practical.

  • dagparse2.patch 2346 bytes added by tstclair on 2011-Jun-02 21:14:06 UTC.
    updated patch for review. switch to call RemoveRunning with a optional param to force removal.
